name: ceramic factory construction | ceramic factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7666/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of 1 ceramic plant. Data was based on a factory with a yearly output of 5.000 t of ceramic products, a life time of 50 years for buildings and of 25 years for machines is assumed. ;This dataset represents the construction of 1 ceramic plant. Data was based on a factory with a yearly output of 5.000 t of ceramic products, a life time of 50 years for buildings and of 25 years for machines. 

From unoccupied land foreseen for a ceramic plant. 

This activity ends with the constructed buildings and machineries for a ceramic plant, as well as their disposal.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data was obtained from Austrian industries.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data of the infrastructure corresponds to a large scale production plant in Europe.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data was based on information from a major producer of sanitary ceramics in Europe. The source of the information is an environmental report of a company (ÖSPAG), that refers to the years 2000 and 2001 and to two Austrian factories. 
A weighted mean value of the flows from the different years and factories is calculated. Detailed information on production waste is reported. This degree of detail is not available for input material. Thus some waste fractions without corresponding input are inventoried.

exchanges.description:
This module is based on a ceramics factory with a yearly output of 5.000 t of ceramic products, a life time of 50 years for buildings and of 25 years for machines. The infrastructure needed for ceramic production consists basically of a building, storage for raw materials, mills, mixers and kilns.

exchanges.description:
Estimation, based on literature values.
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.

exchanges.description: Estimation. The lifetime of the buildings is assumed 50 years, while this is of 25 years for the industrial machines. Therefore the machines are inventoried twice for the total operation time of the plant.
